results.title: The Lady from Shanghai
results.brief_description: Orson Welles never played by Hollywood’s rules. This startling film, which begins as a conventional film noir, turns into a sumptuous exploration of the visual possibilities of cinema. The lighting, cinematography, sound and editing have the austerity and beauty of a classical score. Rita Hayworth is the ambiguous centre of the film, a “femme fatale” whose behaviour continually disturbs the expectations of the viewer, as much as it confuses her obsessed lover, Michael (Orson Welles). On its release the film shocked Hollywood. Its eroticism is intense and arousing; the central characters amoral and violent. Initially maligned, the film helped destroy Welles Hollywood career but its power remains undiminished and in Europe it was quickly recognised as one of the masterworks of American cinema. Justly famous for its thrilling climax in a Hall of Mirrors, “The Lady of Shangai” is a rivetting suspense film with moments of dazzling beauty and virtuosity. Based on the novel by Sherman Woods.

results.title: The King of New York
results.creator_credit: Reteitalia, Mary Kane, Vittorio Squillante and Abel Ferrara
results.brief_description: Christopher Walken stars as a drug lord turned good guy in this crime film directed by Abel Ferrara. Frank White is released from prison, a reformed man and sets out to take over New York City, in order to prevent the closure of a hospital in the South Bronx where he grew up. With the help of a few gangster friends, he begins to take over the entire drug industry in the city, killing those standing in his way. As his takeover begins to succeed he brings in more recruits, but unknowingly starts a underground war between crime groups in the city. Cast also includes Larry Fishburne, Wesley Snipes, David Caruso and Steve Buscemi.

results.title: The King of Marvin Gardens
results.brief_description: Radio personality David Staebler (Jack Nicholson), uses his brother’s life story as fodder for his radio ramblings, thus anticipating the “talk jocks” of the 1980’s and 90’s. David’s brother Jason (Bruce Dern), is full of lofty ambitions but lacks the wherewithal to accomplish them. He has managed to survive for so long thanks to the help of his older brother. His latest vision for success involves building a resort on a small Hawaiian island and he intends to raise the capital by holding a beauty contest and wining and dining rich Japanese businessmen. Along with Jason’s long suffering wife (Ellen Burstyn), David reluctantly agrees to support his brother one more time.

results.title: The King of comedy
results.creator_credit: Embassy International Pictures, Arnon Milchan and Martin Scorsese
results.brief_description: Rupert Pupkin (Robert De Niro), is an aspiring comedian obsessed with TV talk show host, Jerry Langford (Jerry Lewis). After co-ordinating a meeting with his idol, Rupert tells Langford about the comedy material he has written. Langford is as charming as he is dismissive, and after being repeatedly rejected and eventually ejected by Langford’s staff, Rupert decides to take matters into his own hands, conspiring a sensationally irresponsible scheme to beat defeat. The ‘King of Comedy’ is widely seen as Martin Scorsese’s cynically black-comic reaction to the media firestorm that followed his 1976 film ‘Taxi Driver’.

results.title: The King and I
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Charles Brackett and Walter Lang
results.brief_description: This visual and musical masterpiece features Yul Brynner’s Academy Award winning performance, an unforgettable Rodgers and Hammerstein score, and brilliant choreography by Jerome Robbins. It tells the true story of an Englishwoman, Anna Leonowens who comes to Siam as a school teacher to the royal court in the 1860’s. Winner of five Academy Awards, “The King and I” contains some of the most lavish sets and costumes in Hollywood history, and some of the world’s best loved songs. Also stars Deborah Kerr.

results.title: The Killing of Angel Street
results.brief_description: Jessica Simmonds returns home from London and is shocked to find the street she grew up in being torn apart to make way for a high rise development. She sympathises with the plight of the local residents, who are being forced out of their homes by the brutal tactics of the developers. Probing into the background of Angel street development, she unearths a sinister connection between organised crime, the developer, the police and the highest levels of government.

results.title: The Killing of a Chinese bookie
results.creator_credit: Faces Distribution Corporation, Al Ruban and John Cassavetes
results.brief_description: The Killing of a Chinese Bookie presents a portrait of a man who is so self-sufficient that he cannot become personally involved with anyone. Cosmo Vitelli, played by Ben Gazzara, is a nightclub owner who believes in conducting his personal and business affairs with plenty of flair and professionalism. When the mob threatens him he works desperately to save his face and the club.

results.title: The Killing
results.creator_credit: Harris-Kubrick Pictures Corporation, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, James B. Harris and Stanley Kubrick
results.brief_description: A race-track robbery is planned with clockwork precision but Kubrick dispassionately observes how the mechanism is ruined by human fallibility. The intricate flashback structure presents a plot of chess-like moves in a hard boiled, visually stylised underworld richly populated by film noir stereotypes. Based on the novel “Clean Break” by Lionel White. Cast includes Sterling Hayden, Coleen Gray, Vince Edwards and Jay C Flippen.

results.title: The Killer nun = Suor omicidi [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Cinesud, Enzo Gallo and Giulio Berruti
results.brief_description: A former ‘video-nasty’ and one of the few examples of the perversely themed ‘nunsploitation’ genre, which is basically a thinly veiled excuse for some soft core erotica. The usual ingredients for this genre are all present in The Killer nun, that being drug addicted nuns, lesbianism, sadism, murder, necrophilia and lashings of nudity. Anita Ekberg stars as sister Gertrude a sexually repressed, morphine addicted nun who descends into madness when her elderly patients begin to get murdered, making her the prime suspect. Soon enough the unhinged sister is shooting up, having sex with strange men and making inappropriate advances at her fellow sisters. Cast includes Joe Dallesandro, Alida Valli, Lou Castel. Also known as Suor omicidi.

results.title: The Kid stays in the picture
results.creator_credit: Highway Films, Ministry of Propaganda Films, Graydon Carter, Brett Morgan and Nanette Burstein
results.brief_description: Based on the book “The Kid stays in the picture” by Robert Evans comes this documentary about the life of Robert Evans. Good looking actor turned producer and at quite a young age, the head of production at Paramount Studios. This self-made maverick decided that he wanted the power that came with being a producer, witnessed when he, as a young actor, was going to be sacked from a film because he was an unknown. He stayed “in the picture” and as head of the Studio in the late 1960s and early 1970s was responsible for some of the era’s best films such as “The Godfather”, “Rosemary’s Baby”, “Love Story”, “The Odd Couple”, “Harold and Maude” and “Chinatown”. Original interviews and footage from the era combine with a voiceover narration by Robert Evans to give this documentary a lively pace - suited to a man who was once married to Ali MacGraw, had money and power, an unfortunate drug habit and his name muddied by a murder trial. A revealing look into some of the machinations of the Hollywood studio system and the luxurious Hollywood lifestyle.
